channel.title: Barrows effects
channel.description: how can i add barrows specials powers on 317 source ???? :confused: :confused: :confused:

item.title: Barrows effects
item.dc:creator: @NewbieNewty Newty
item.description:
@NewbieNewty wrote:

[quote="`Rich, post:12, topic:281583"][quote author=Newty link=topic=372009.msg2810089#msg2810089 date=1243948886]
Here’s somewhat of an example.

Like apoc said, use your process timer (in client.java)

First declare the following near some other int’s (not in process):

int theEffect = 10;

In process:



if (playerEquipment[playerShield] == 1234 && playerEquipment[playerHat] == 2345 && theEffect == 0) {
doAnAnimation();
theEffect = 10;
}

if (theEffect > 0) {
theEffect--;
}

Now you can make it so it only work’s in combat, etc. The item’s I used, “1234”, and “2345” were just examples.
[/quote]

What the fuck is the point in processing this? Just calculate the Dharoks special effect when it’s checking for the player’s max hit, for Guthans just randomize it’s effects and add the hit to the player’s hitpoints, Veracs can be done using a system exactly like you calculate the chance of hitting the other player in a combat situation, just with a higher chance at hitting (hidden attack bonus basically).[/quote]

Never though of doing it that way, not to mention, I wouldn’t have done it that way if I were actually adding it myself.

Read full topic

item.title: Barrows effects
item.dc:creator: @_Rich Rich
item.description:
@_Rich wrote:

[quote=“Newty, post:9, topic:281583”]Here’s somewhat of an example.

Like apoc said, use your process timer (in client.java)

First declare the following near some other int’s (not in process):

int theEffect = 10;

In process:



if (playerEquipment[playerShield] == 1234 && playerEquipment[playerHat] == 2345 && theEffect == 0) {
doAnAnimation();
theEffect = 10;
}

if (theEffect > 0) {
theEffect--;
}

Now you can make it so it only work’s in combat, etc. The item’s I used, “1234”, and “2345” were just examples.[/quote]

What the fuck is the point in processing this?

Just calculate the Dharoks special effect when it’s checking for the player’s max hit, for Guthans just randomize it’s effects and add the hit to the player’s hitpoints if the effect is activated, Veracs can be done using a system exactly like you calculate the chance of hitting the other player in a combat situation, just with a higher chance at hitting (hidden attack bonus basically).

Read full topic

item.title: Barrows effects
item.dc:creator: @NewbieNewty Newty
item.description:
@NewbieNewty wrote:

Here’s somewhat of an example.

Like apoc said, use your process timer (in client.java)

First declare the following near some other int’s (not in process):

int theEffect = 10;

In process:



if (playerEquipment[playerShield] == 1234 && playerEquipment[playerHat] == 2345 && theEffect == 0) {
doAnAnimation();
theEffect = 10;
}

if (theEffect > 0) {
theEffect--;
}

Now you can make it so it only work’s in combat, etc. The item’s I used, “1234”, and “2345” were just examples.

Read full topic

@Evil1 wrote:

Look for the process method (The one being called every couple ms) and in there, check if the person is wearing the complete set. If they are, procede to doing what the set does.
